title: Guadalupe Mountains National Park: Park Home
body: Waiting to be Explored!  Guadalupe Mountains National Park is the world's premier example of a fossil reef from the Permian Era.  The park is known for its extensive hiking and backpacking opportunities in one of the nation's most pristine wilderness areas.  Birding, history, and many other opportunities to learn and have fun await visitors in this hidden gem of West Texas.                Centennial Sunrise on Guadalupe Peak   Join us for a campout and inspirational sunrise service on Guadalupe Peak to celebrate the 100th birthday of the National Park Service.         Tierra Firme Workshops   Explore your creative side! Join Art in the Parks volunteers in loom weaving and natural dye workshops.               Camping in Pine Springs & Dog Canyon   Learn about primitive camping at the Pine Springs and Dog Canyon campgrounds. Find information on tent and RV sites.         Calendar of Events   The park's calendar includes information on fee free days, evening programs and ranger guided hikes.
